com.datasift.dropwizard.kafka.consumer

Class SynchronousConsumer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datasift.dropwizard.kafka.consumer.SynchronousConsumer<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KafkaConsumer, Managed

    public class SynchronousConsumer<T>
extends Object
implements KafkaConsumer, Managed
    A KafkaConsumer that processes messages synchronously using an ExecutorService.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SynchronousConsumer(kafka.javaapi.consumer.ConsumerConnector connector, Map<String,Integer> partitions, kafka.serializer.Decoder<T> decoder, StreamProcessor<T> processor, ExecutorService executor)
      Creates a SynchronousConsumer to process a stream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SynchronousConsumer

        public SynchronousConsumer(kafka.javaapi.consumer.ConsumerConnector connector,
                   Map<String,Integer> partitions,
                   kafka.serializer.Decoder<T> decoder,
                   StreamProcessor<T> processor,
                   ExecutorService executor)
        Creates a SynchronousConsumer to process a stream.
        Parameters:
        connector - the ConsumerConnector of the underlying consumer.
        partitions - a mapping of the topic -> partitions to consume.
        decoder - a Decoder for decoding each Message to type T before being processed.
        processor - a StreamProcessor for processing messages of type T.
        executor - the ExecutorService to process the stream with.

    • Method Detail

      • commitOffsets

        public void commitOffsets()
        Commits the currently consumed offsets.
        Specified by:
        commitOffsets in interface KafkaConsumer
        See Also:
        ConsumerConnector.commitOffsets()

      • start

        public void start()
           throws Exception
        Starts this SynchronousConsumer immediately.

        The consumer will immediately begin consuming from the configured topics using the configured Decoder to decode messages and StreamProcessor to process the decoded messages.

        Each partition will be consumed using a separate thread.

        Specified by:
        start in interface Managed
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs starting the consumer

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws Exception
        Stops this SynchronousConsumer immediately.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Managed
        Throws:
        Exception

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Determines if this KafkaConsumer is currently consuming.
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface KafkaConsumer
        Returns:
        true if this KafkaConsumer is currently consuming from at least one partition; otherwise, false.
